maml:description.maml:para: Adds a member to a specific Role of a specific database.
The Add-RoleMember cmdlet adds a valid member to a specific Role of a specific database depending upon the input values.
Name of the member who should be added to the role.
Database name to which the Role belongs to.
Name of the Role to which the member should be added.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Name of the member who should be added to the role.
The Microsoft.AnalysisServices.Role to add a member to. This not applicable to tabular databases with compatibility level 1200 or higher.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Name of the member who should be added to the role.
Database name to which the Role belongs to.
Name of the Role to which the member should be added.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
The Microsoft.AnalysisServices.Role to add a member to. This not applicable to tabular databases with compatibility level 1200 or higher.

maml:alert.maml:para: Supported on all Analysis Services instances

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a member to the first role of a given database.
Add a member to the first role of a given database using named parameters for a tabular database with compatibility level 1200 or higher.
Add a member to the database role using the role's name

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a database administrator to take the backup of Analysis Service Database to a file.

Enables a database administrator to take the backup of Analysis Service Database to a file. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered. Database Administrator can also pass multiple databases through pipeline and perform the backup operation.

The backup file path/name where database will be backed up. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered.
This parameter will only be used if the database to backup is specified with the Name parameter, not if it is passed in with the Database parameter.
Analysis Services Database Name that has to be backed up.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during backup.
Indicates whether remote partitions will be backed up or not.
Indicates whether the backup file will be compressed or not.
The password to be used with backup file encryption
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during backup.
Indicates whether remote partitions will be backed up or not.
Indicates whether the backup file will be compressed or not.
The password to be used with backup file encryption
The Database or Databases to be backed up. The filename of the backup will be the same as the database.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

The backup file path/name where database will be backed up. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered.
This parameter will only be used if the database to backup is specified with the Name parameter, not if it is passed in with the Database parameter.
Analysis Services Database Name that has to be backed up.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during backup.
Indicates whether remote partitions will be backed up or not.
Indicates whether the backup file will be compressed or not.
The password to be used with backup file encryption
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
The Database or Databases to be backed up. The filename of the backup will be the same as the database.

maml:alert.maml:para: Supported on all Analysis Services instances

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Backup database with compression and encrypted --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Enables a database administrator to execute an XMLA script, Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) query, or Data Mining Extensions (DMX) statement against an instance of Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services.

Enables a database administrator to execute an XMLA script, Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) query, or Data Mining Extensions (DMX) statement against an instance of Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services. The cmdlets execution of these queries or scripts within input files. The script that is passed is an XAML command and following commands are supported.

Alter, Backup, Batch, BeginTransaction, Cancel, ClearCache, CommitTransaction, Create, Delete, DesignAggregations, Drop, Insert, Lock, MergePartitions, NotifyTableChange, Process, Restore, RollbackTransaction, Statement (used to execute MDX queries and DMX statements), Subscribe, Synchronize, Unlock, Update, UpdateCells.
This script will also accept JSON commands designed to execute against a tabular database with compatibility mode 1200 or higher.

Specifies the database against which an MDX query or DMX statement will execute. The database parameter is ignored when the cmdlet executes an XMLA script, because the database name is embedded in the XMLA script.
Specifies the actual script, query, or statement directly on the command line instead of in a file.
Specifies the number of seconds before the queries time out. If a timeout value is not specified, the queries do not time out. The timeout must be an integer between 1 and 65535.

Specifies the number of seconds before the connection to the Analysis Services instance times out. The timeout value must be an integer between 0 and 65534. If 0 is specified, connection attempts do not time out.

Identifies a file that receives Analysis Services trace events while executing the XMLA script, MDX query, or DMX statement. If the file already exists, it is automatically overwritten (except for the trace files that are created by using the -TraceLevel:Duration and –TraceLevel:DurationResult parameter settings). File names that contain spaces must be enclosed in quotation marks (" "). If the file name is not valid, an error message is generated.

Specifies the number of seconds the Analysis Services engine waits before ending the trace (if you specify the –TraceFile parameter). The trace is considered finished if no trace messages have been recorded during the specified time period. The default trace time-out value is 5 seconds.
Specifies what data is collected and recorded in the trace file. Possible values are High, Medium, Low, Duration, DurationResult.
Specifies the file format for the –TraceFile parameter (if this parameter is specified). The available options are text or csv. The default value is "csv".
Specifies a single character as the trace file delimiter when you specify csv as the format for the trace file that use the –TraceFileFormat parameter. Default is | (pipe, or vertical bar).
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

Specifies the database against which an MDX query or DMX statement will execute. The database parameter is ignored when the cmdlet executes an XMLA script, because the database name is embedded in the XMLA script.
Specifies the number of seconds before the queries time out. If a timeout value is not specified, the queries do not time out. The timeout must be an integer between 1 and 65535.

Specifies the number of seconds before the connection to the Analysis Services instance times out. The timeout value must be an integer between 0 and 65534. If 0 is specified, connection attempts do not time out.

Identifies a file that receives Analysis Services trace events while executing the XMLA script, MDX query, or DMX statement. If the file already exists, it is automatically overwritten (except for the trace files that are created by using the -TraceLevel:Duration and –TraceLevel:DurationResult parameter settings). File names that contain spaces must be enclosed in quotation marks (" "). If the file name is not valid, an error message is generated.

Specifies the number of seconds the Analysis Services engine waits before ending the trace (if you specify the –TraceFile parameter). The trace is considered finished if no trace messages have been recorded during the specified time period. The default trace time-out value is 5 seconds.
Specifies what data is collected and recorded in the trace file. Possible values are High, Medium, Low, Duration, DurationResult.
Specifies the file format for the –TraceFile parameter (if this parameter is specified). The available options are text or csv. The default value is "csv".
Specifies a single character as the trace file delimiter when you specify csv as the format for the trace file that use the –TraceFileFormat parameter. Default is | (pipe, or vertical bar).
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

Specifies the database against which an MDX query or DMX statement will execute. The database parameter is ignored when the cmdlet executes an XMLA script, because the database name is embedded in the XMLA script.
Specifies the actual script, query, or statement directly on the command line instead of in a file.
Specifies the number of seconds before the queries time out. If a timeout value is not specified, the queries do not time out. The timeout must be an integer between 1 and 65535.

Specifies the number of seconds before the connection to the Analysis Services instance times out. The timeout value must be an integer between 0 and 65534. If 0 is specified, connection attempts do not time out.

Identifies a file that receives Analysis Services trace events while executing the XMLA script, MDX query, or DMX statement. If the file already exists, it is automatically overwritten (except for the trace files that are created by using the -TraceLevel:Duration and –TraceLevel:DurationResult parameter settings). File names that contain spaces must be enclosed in quotation marks (" "). If the file name is not valid, an error message is generated.

Specifies the number of seconds the Analysis Services engine waits before ending the trace (if you specify the –TraceFile parameter). The trace is considered finished if no trace messages have been recorded during the specified time period. The default trace time-out value is 5 seconds.
Specifies what data is collected and recorded in the trace file. Possible values are High, Medium, Low, Duration, DurationResult.
Specifies the file format for the –TraceFile parameter (if this parameter is specified). The available options are text or csv. The default value is "csv".
Specifies a single character as the trace file delimiter when you specify csv as the format for the trace file that use the –TraceFileFormat parameter. Default is | (pipe, or vertical bar).
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

maml:alert.maml:para: Supported on all Analysis Services instances

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Invoke select --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-ASCmd -Database:"Adventure Works DW 2008R2" -Query:"SELECT {[Measures].[Internet Sales Amount]} ON COLUMNS, BOTTOMCOUNT(NONEMPTY(DESCENDANTS( [Customer].[Customer Geography].[All Customers], [Customer].[Customer Geography].[Customer]), ( [Measures].[Internet Sales Amount] ) ), 10, ( [Measures].[Internet Sales Amount] )) ON ROWS FROM [Adventure Works] WHERE ( [Date].[Calendar].[Calendar Year].&[2008] )"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Invoke select 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-ASCmd -Database:"Adventure Works DW 2008R2" -Query:"SELECT MODEL_CATALOG, MODEL_NAME, ATTRIBUTE_NAME, NODE_NAME FROM [Forecasting].CONTENT"

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet merges the data of one or more source partitions into a target partition and deletes the source partitions.

This cmdlet merges the data of one or more source partitions into a target partition and deletes the source partitions. Partitions can be merged only if they meet all the following criteria: Partitions are in the same measure group. Partitions are stored in the same mode (MOLAP, HOLAP, and ROLAP).
Name of the target partition to where the source partitions data will be merged.
Source partition names from which data is merged to target partition.
Name of the Analysis Server database where the partitions exist.
Name of the cube under which the partitions exist.
Name of the Measure Group under which the partitions exist.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Source partition names from which data is merged to target partition.
Name of the Analysis Server database where the partitions exist.
Name of the cube under which the partitions exist.
Name of the Measure Group under which the partitions exist.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Name of the target partition to where the source partitions data will be merged.
Source partition names from which data is merged to target partition.
Name of the Analysis Server database where the partitions exist.
Name of the cube under which the partitions exist.
Name of the Measure Group under which the partitions exist.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores a specified Analysis Service database from a backup file.

Enables a database administrator to restore the Analysis Service Database from a backup file. If only backup file name is mentioned without the location, the default backup location specified during the installation will be considered.
Restores a specified Analysis Service database from a backup file.
Analysis Services Database Name that has to be restored.
Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during resetore.
Represents security settings for the restore operation.
Remote location of the partitions to be restored.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

Indicates whether the destination files can be overwritten during resetore.
Represents security settings for the restore operation.

Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.

maml:description.maml:para: Conducts the Process operation on a specified Database with a specific ProcessType or RefreshType depending on the underlying metadata type.
Conducts the Process operation on a specified Database with a specific ProcessType or RefreshType depending on the underlying metadata type.

Use ProcessType for database with multidimensional metadata (this includes tabular databases with compatibility level less than 1200). Use RefreshType for tabular databases with compatibility level 1200 or higher.
Optionally specifies the server instance to connect to if not currently in the SQLAS Provider directory.

If this parameter is specified, the user name and password passed will be used to connect to specified Analysis Server instance. If no credentials are specified default windows account of the user who is running the tool will be used.
